name: (1Z,3Z)-3-(hydroxyimino)-1-(2-nitrophenyl)-2,3-diphenylprop-1-en-1-ol
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-788
Reason: The compound (1Z,3Z)-3-(hydroxyimino)-1-(2-nitrophenyl)-2,3-diphenylprop-1-en-1-ol has a complex structure with multiple functional groups that contribute to its melting point. The base structure of 2,3-diphenylprop-1-en-1-ol has a melting point of approximately -40°C. The hydroxyimino group (-NH2) adds a significant increase in melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds, which can be estimated at around +50°C to +70°C. The nitro group (NO2) adds to the melting point due to its electronegativity and polarizability, which can be estimated at around +20°C to +30°C. The phenyl groups (C6H5) add to the melting point due to their bulkiness and potential for pi-pi stacking, which can be estimated at around +20°C to +30°C. The presence of two phenyl groups in a trans configuration can increase the melting point due to better packing in the solid state, which can be estimated at around +5°C.
